revised_title: A New Series for Computing the Ratio of Circle's Diameter to Its Circumference
tldr: William Rutherford investigates a new and simple series to compute the ratio of a circle's diameter to its circumference with high accuracy. He compares it to John Machin's series and provides a more efficient method for calculations. The resulting value of n is given to 208 decimal places, presumed to be accurate to the last figure.
